page.title: 19GENERAL TRENDS,DRAYTON AREA
page.content: {Drayton,Taverham and Costessey}as a whole provide a very accurate indication of the current trends that prevail in{East Anglia in 1985.}The area has seen new developments in {housing, industry}and in the job situation,being at present comfortably prosperous while much of the country is suffering from economic recession and unemployment.{Farming}is,as ever, a major factor in Norfolk, but much of the traditional industry has given way to mechanisation and the growth of the service industries.The area has seen a lot of{foreign investment}particularly from the Low Countries, as well as the emergence of North Sea oil and gas as a major employer.The area has lost much of its{former rural charm}and is in danger of becoming a sprawling suburb as more houses are built to cater for the influx of people.
